means: <贬>忧郁地闲荡( mope的过去式和过去分词 )
机动脚踏两用车；摩托自行车

sentence.Network_en: He moped around the office for a while, feeling bored.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在办公室闲荡了一会儿，感到百无聊赖。

sentence.Network_en: He moped about because he wasn't invited to the party.
sentence.Network_cn: 他闷闷不乐地徘徊,因为没有人请他去参加聚会.

sentence.Network_en: I would advise against riding moped without testing the brakes first .
sentence.Network_cn: 我反对不先试一下闸就骑机动脚踏两用车。

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1950s: from Swedish, from (trampcykel med) mo(tor och) ped(aler) 'pedal cycle with motor and pedals'

entry.tran: 电动自行车；机动脚踏车；助力车
entry.def: A moped is a small motorcycle which you can also pedal like a bicycle.

means.word_mean: 1. a motorbike that can be pedaled or driven by a low-powered gasoline engine

auth_sentence.content: I don't own a car and have no use for a moped or scooter.
auth_sentence.res_content: I don't own a car and have no use for a moped or scooter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I don't own a car and have no use for a moped or scooter.

auth_sentence.content: My last accident was in July, when I was run over from behind by a pair on a stolen moped at a busy gyratory in Hammersmith.
auth_sentence.res_content: My last accident was in July, when I was run over from behind by a pair on a stolen moped at a busy gyratory in Hammersmith.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My last accident was in July, when I was run over from behind by a pair on a stolen moped at a busy gyratory in Hammersmith.

auth_sentence.content: I won't be happy until all restaurants operate off the back of a moped and the food is shot at you.
